meanings.sent1: The teacher found the student's antipoetic attitude towards poetry concerning.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style is often antipoetic, focusing more on facts than emotions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's antipoetic refusal to appreciate the beauty of the sunset was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His rigid and antipoetic view on art made him blind to the magic around him.
meanings.sent5: The storm's destructive force was as antipoetic as a bulldozer in a rose garden.

meanings.definition: Not having the qualities of poetry.
meanings.sent1: The plain and antipoetic language of the manual made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: His speech was so antipoetic that it lacked any emotional impact.
meanings.sent3: The antipoetic nature of the traffic jam turned it into a dull comedy.
meanings.sent4: The factory's smokestacks stood tall, casting an antipoetic shadow over the town.
meanings.sent5: The antipoetic prose of the report made it a chore to read, devoid of any beauty.

meanings.sent1: The building's design was antipoetic, with no grace or elegance in its structure.
meanings.sent2: Her voice was antipoetic, lacking the lyrical quality that usually captivates audiences.
meanings.sent3: The antipoetic dance routine had the audience chuckling at its awkwardness.
meanings.sent4: The city's skyline looked antipoetic under the blanket of smog.
meanings.sent5: The antipoetic painting failed to evoke any emotion, leaving viewers indifferent.
